de.btu.openinfra.backend.db.daos

Class OpenInfraDao<TypePojo extends OpenInfraPojo,TypeModel extends OpenInfraModelObject>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.btu.openinfra.backend.db.daos.OpenInfraDao<TypePojo,TypeModel>
  • Type Parameters:
    TypePojo - defines the referring POJO class of the DAO class
    TypeModel - defines the referring JPA model class of the DAO class
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AttributeTypeGroupDao, AttributeValueDomainDao, AttributeValueGeomDao, AttributeValueValueDao, CharacterCodeDao, CountryCodeDao, CredentialsDao, DatabaseConnectionDao, DatabasesDao, FileDao, LanguageCodeDao, LevelDao, LogDao, LoggerDao, MetaDataDao, MultiplicityDao, OpenInfraObjectDao, OpenInfraValueDao, PasswordBlacklistDao, PermissionDao, PortsDao, ProjectDao, ProjectRelatedRoleDao, ProjectsDao, PtFreeTextDao, PtLocaleDao, RoleDao, RolePermissionDao, SchemasDao, ServersDao, SettingKeysDao, SettingsDao, SubjectDao, SubjectProjectDao, SubjectRoleDao, SupportedMimeTypeDao, ValueListDao, WebappDao

    public abstract class OpenInfraDao<TypePojo extends OpenInfraPojo,TypeModel extends OpenInfraModelObject>
extends Object
    This class is used to provide a sophisticated way to manage the JPA entity manager.
    Author:
    BTU DBIS

    • Constructor Detail

      • OpenInfraDao

        protected OpenInfraDao(UUID currentProjectId,
            OpenInfraSchemas schema,
            Class<TypeModel> modelClass)
        This method represents the super constructor in order to create an entity manager for each data access object (DAO) in a sophisticated way. We decided to use an application managed entity manager in order to have more control about its properties and its life cycle. Each DAO provides its own entity manager and the lifetime of the entity manager depends on the lifetime of the DAO object. The entity manager is automatically closed by the finalize method. Thus, don't call the close method on the entity manager otherwise you'll get an exception if you try to access the entity manager again. This method sets the properties of the connection dynamically. If you would like to change the connection, this should be the first class to look at. The connection strings should be managed by a configuration (properties) file or by a database. The super constructor will use the current project id in order to access the meta database and to retrieve the credentials of the currently used project database. If the current project id is set to null and the corresponding schema is specified, the super constructor will provide access to the system database. In order to change the schema value you have to consider query parameters of the connection URL like so: "jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/openinfra?currentSchema=project". By considering this, you'll be able to modify the required schema easily, nicely and dynamically during runtime. TODO in order to add a User Rights Management system add specific functions here
        Parameters:
        currentProjectId - The identifier of the current project.
        schema - This parameter defines the schema.
        modelClass - The underlying JPA model class.

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public List<TypePojo> read(Locale locale,
                  int offset,
                  int size)
        This is the default generic method which provides read access to the selected database schema without sorting. It is almost the same routine for all DAO classes to access the database.
        Parameters:
        locale - A Java.util locale objects.
        offset - the number where to start
        size - the size of items to provide
        Returns:
        a list of objects of type POJO class

      • read

        public List<TypePojo> read(Locale locale,
                  OpenInfraSortOrder order,
                  OpenInfraOrderBy column,
                  int offset,
                  int size)
        This is a generic method which provides read access to the selected database schema. It is almost the same routine for all DAO classes to access the database. If not, this method should be extended in order to avoid overrides. Overrides could increase the effort regarding the integration and maintenance of a rights management system. Since the system schema doesn't provide the project_id column for topic characteristic objects it is necessary to handle this request separately. The meta data schema is also handled separately. Don't use this method while using RBAC, FILE or WEBAPP schemas!
        Parameters:
        locale - A Java.util locale objects.
        order - the sort order (ascending or descending)
        column - the column to sort
        offset - the number where to start
        size - the size of items to provide
        Returns:
        a list of objects of type POJO class
        Throws:
        OpenInfraEntityException - for unsupported orderBy types
        OpenInfraWebException - for internal server errors

      • read

        public List<TypeModel> read()
        A special method which returns model objects. This method is primarily used to create a search index.
        Returns:
        a list of all model objects

      • read

        public List<TypeModel> read(int offset,
                   int size)
        A special method which returns model objects. This method is primarily used to create a search index. Window functionality is provided to avoid out of memory exceptions.
        Parameters:
        offset - This will determine the offset
        size -
        Returns:
        a list of all model objects

      • createOrUpdate

        public UUID createOrUpdate(TypePojo pojo,
                  UUID valueId)
        This function creates a new or updates an existing object in the database. The update function depends on the specified language.
        Parameters:
        pojo - the POJO object which should be stored in the database
        valueId - the UUID of the specific object - should be null for create or POST requests
        Returns:
        the UUID of the newly created or replaced object
        Throws:
        RuntimeException

      • read

        public TypePojo read(Locale locale,
            UUID id)
        This is a generic method which reads a specific pojo object. We decided to hide this functionality behind a protected class so that each deriving class must implement its own read method. This should provide more type safety.
        Parameters:
        locale - A Java.util locale object.
        id - the UUID of the required model class
        Returns:
        The requested POJO object if present otherwise null.

      • mapToPojo

        public abstract TypePojo mapToPojo(Locale locale,
                 TypeModel modelObject)
        This is an abstract method which must be implemented by deriving classes. It should map a JPA model object into corresponding a POJO object. This method is really slow. Thus, don't use this method too often. It's recommended to provide another static method which should be much faster.
        Parameters:
        modelObject - the JPA model object
        Returns:
        a corresponding POJO object

      • mapToModel

        public abstract MappingResult<TypeModel> mapToModel(TypePojo pojoObject,
                                  TypeModel modelObject)
        This is an abstract method which must be implemented by deriving classes. It should map a POJO object into a corresponding JPA model object.
        Parameters:
        modelObject - the pre initialized model object
        pojoObject - the POJO object
        Returns:
        a corresponding JPA model object
        Throws:
        OpenInfraEntityException

      • delete

        public boolean delete(UUID uuid)
        This method deletes an entity from the database. Previously it checks if meta data exists for this entity and delete it as well.
        Parameters:
        uuid - the uuid which specifies the entity
        Returns:
        true when the entity was deleted false when the uuid doesn't exists

      • createModelObject

        protected TypeModel createModelObject(UUID id)
        This method delivers a model object. When the UUID is not null this method tries to deliver an existing object. When the UUID is null it creates a new object and generates a random UUID. This is a very central method which is always called when a POJO object is mapped into a model object.
        Parameters:
        id - the UUID of the requested object or null
        Returns:
        a model object (new or old) or null if the pojo id doesn't exists

      • getCount

        public long getCount()
        This method retrieves the count of objects and uses a named query. If the query doesn't exists, it will throw an exception.
        Returns:
        count of objects or zero

      • finalize

        protected void finalize()
                 throws Throwable
        This method closes the entity manager automatically. Don't close the entity manager manually. This will cause an exception when you try to access the entity manager again during life time of the current object instance.
        Overrides:
        finalize in class Object
        Throws:
        Throwable

      • checkOrderBy

        protected void checkOrderBy(OpenInfraOrderBy column)
        This method retrieves the list of objects from the OpenInfraOrderByEnum for the passed orderBy column and compares it with the current object. If the current object is not part of the retrieved list, an OpenInfraEntityException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        column -
        Throws:
        OpenInfraEntityException - if the current object is not supported by the OpenInfraOrderByEnum for the passed column
